Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

to totter or waver (through weakness of the legs, especially the ankle); by implication, to falter, stumble, faint or fall

2.brief: to take (in the widest variety of applications)
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
near, with or among; often in general, to

near, with or among; often in general, to
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
to take (in the widest variety of applications)

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
to be safe (in mind, body or estate); figuratively, to be (causatively, make) completed; by implication, to be friendly; by extension, to reciprocate (in various applications)
a bullock (apparently as breaking forth in wild strength, or perhaps as dividing the hoof)
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)

3.brief: Ashshur, the second son of Shem; also his descendants and the country occupied by them (i.e. Assyria), its region and its empire
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a horse (as leaping); also a swallow (from its rapid flight)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to ride (on an animal or in a vehicle); causatively, to place upon (for riding or generally), to despatch
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more

an action (good or bad); generally, a transaction; abstractly, activity; by implication, a product (specifically, a poem) or (generally) property
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to fondle; by implication, to love, especially to compassionate

to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)

Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
to break forth as a bud, i.e. bloom; generally, to spread; specifically, to fly (as extending the wings); figuratively, to flourish

to strike (lightly or severely, literally or figuratively)

verdant; by analogy, new; figuratively, prosperous
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present
